review: I'm not normally a tech impulse buyer and the TV commercial wasn't real clear on what the Chromecast can do. I figured, however, it was worth $35 to find out. It doesn't replace a Roku or Apple TV. It streams specific content including You-Tube, Hulu, Netflix and Google Play from your smartphone or tablet to be displayed on your HD TV screen. It will also stream web pages from Chrome on your desktop - as long as these all have a wireless network connection. It was confusing to set up (I'm in my late 50's) but we got there and it has been worth it. My wife is thrilled that she can watch the season of Sons of Anarchy that she bought, on the big screen instead of just her tablet screen.
author: J. L. Martin
